intro: Adesmia inflexa, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrpear, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, pea-like inflorescences, and it produces woody pods that contain several seeds. Adesmia inflexa is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it an important species in desert ecosystems.
